meta.description: The annual survey about the current State of Technical communication

welcome_screens.title:
Thanks for taking this survey! Together, maybe we'll be able to figure out this Technical Communication thing once and for all!

Also, we know this survey seems long, but it's mostly the same questions repeated for different frameworks and libraries. Most people only take around *10 minutes* to fill it in.

thankyou_screens.title:
Thanks for completing this typeform
Now *create your own* ‚Äî it's free, easy, & beautiful

fields.title:
Table Of Contents

1. Authoring Language Flavors
2. Information Gathering
3. Structure
4. Content Management Systems
5. Quality
6. Authoring Tools
7. Other Tools - Languages, APIs‚Ä¶

For each of the following Technical Communication feature, please pick one of the following options:

- ü§∑ You've never heard about it, or are not sure what it is 
- ‚úÖ You've heard about it but *haven't* used it 
- üëç You've used it in a project

properties.description: For these tools & technologies, just check the ones that you use regularly.
What other programming languages do you regularly use?
Which browser APIs have you used before?
Which build tool(s) are you currently using?
Which utility libraries do you regularly use?
Which text editor(s) do you regularly use?
How do you feel about the state of Technical Communications?

fields.title: Technical Communications is moving in the right direction
Building Docs is overly complex right now
I would like Technical Writing to be my main job
The Technical Communications ecosystem is not changing fast enough
This survey is too damn long!

properties.description: Let's get to know the real you.
What you call yourself.
How you network and socialize.
What part of the global economy you support.
The department you work for in your organization.
How big is your specific team.
How long you've been chasing down SMEs.

fields.title: How did you find out about this survey?

properties.description: If you'd like to be notified when survey results are available. Your email won't be used for any other purpose.
Things we missed, feedback on the survey, your favorite color, etc.
This survey is useful and asks useful questions that I am interested in seeing statistics about.
What would you improve about this survey? Please give specific examples of things you would add, new questions you would add, and things you would remove.
Was there any confusing questions on this survey and how would you improve them?
